page.title: 07Guinea fowl
page.content: A recent addition to the farmyard animals in the area is the{Guinea {fowl.}They are bred for their{meat, which has a darker appearance than the usual chicken, either fresh or frozen,and a stronger flavour. Their {eggs,}though smaller than a chicken's, have a comparatively large yolk, so make an attractive and economical buy for the shopper. They are never reared in large numbers because of their fairly wild nature, and they roost in trees. If they could be bred in intensive conditions, there would probably be a reasonable hotel trade for such birds. We found the Guinea fowl wandering freely within the environment of the farm which breeds them, and they caused not a little inconvenience to the motorist as they wandered along the roads.
